intro: Malanea ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorean malanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are often white or pale pink. Malanea ecuadorensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
